title: Deep Learning-Based Pupil Tracking Design for Visible Light Wearable Eye Trackers

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational understanding of machine learning, linear algebra, probability theory, and Python programming experience
context.additional_context: Theory-practice parallel course including smartphone-based practical training in limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can understand the YOLOv3-tiny model architecture and apply it to pupil tracking
Learners can explain hyperparameter optimization methods for achieving over 80% accuracy in visible light environments
Learners can design data preprocessing and postprocessing workflows to achieve tracking errors within two pixels

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
